# Controls
You can change your keybinds at any time here:
## Movement To move, use [color=yellow][bold][keybind="MoveUp"][keybind="MoveLeft"][keybind="MoveDown"][keybind="MoveRight"][/bold][/color].
Slippery objects and surfaces will cause you to lose your footing and become momentarily stunned. Hold [color=yellow][bold][keybind="Walk"][/bold][/color] to walk slowly and prevent slipping on most of them. (Note: you can switch walking to a [color=cyan]toggle[/color] in the controls menu.)
You can [color=cyan]pull[/color] entities, including players. To start pulling, click [color=yellow][bold][keybind="TryPullObject"][/bold][/color] on a movable entity. While pulling, you can push the entity to your cursor with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="MovePulledObject"][/bold][/color]. Press [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ReleasePulledObject"][/bold][/color] to let go.
You may find yourself in a situation with [color=#EB2D3A][bold]low gravity[/bold][/color]. You'll be able to control movement direction as long as you're within reach of any structure. If you end up completely off-station in space, you'll need to [bold]throw objects[/bold] or [bold]spray a fire-extinguisher[/bold] to propel yourself according to the laws of motion.
## Hands Click [color=yellow][bold][keybind="Use"][/bold][/color] on holdable items to pick them up with your active hand — make sure it's empty first. Swap between hands with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="SwapHands"][/bold][/color] to control which one is active. Pay attention to the active hand when using item-related hotkeys — they only affect that hand.
To [color=cyan]drop[/color] an item from your active hand, use [color=yellow][bold][keybind="Drop"][/bold][/color]. You can also [color=cyan]throw[/color] it to your cursor with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ThrowItemInHand"][/bold][/color].
## Inventory Your character has an [bold]inventory[/bold] for equipment and clothing. Toggle your [color=cyan]clothing inventory[/color] with the [color=yellow][bold][keybind="OpenInventoryMenu"][/bold][/color] hotkey (or by clicking the bottom leftmost icon). If you want to [color=cyan]wear[/color] a piece of equipment: have it in your active hand, then press [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ActivateItemInHand"][/bold][/color] or click the item, or click the appropriate slot. De-equip items by clicking on them.
Two of the slots on your hotbar correspond to your [bold]bag and belt[/bold]. If you have a bag or belt equipped, you can quickly access them using the [color=yellow][bold][keybind="OpenBackpack"][/bold][/color] and [color=yellow][bold][keybind="OpenBelt"][/bold][/color] hotkeys, respectively. Alternatively, you can open them by using [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color] on their hotbar slots or by clicking the mini icon in the [bold]bottom right[/bold] of their icons.
Pressing [color=yellow][bold][keybind="MoveStoredItem"][/bold][/color] will [color=cyan]take an item out[/color] of an inventory. While holding it down, you can [color=cyan]drag[/color] the item to a different spot in the same container or [color=cyan]rotate[/color] it with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="RotateStoredItem"][/bold][/color].
To halve a stack, use [color=yellow][bold][keybind="AltActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color].
[color=yellow][bold][keybind="SmartEquipBackpack"][/bold][/color] lets you swap items between your hands and the bag. [color=yellow][bold][keybind="SmartEquipBelt"][/bold][/color] does the same for your belt, making tool access faster.
## Interactions Clicking [color=yellow][bold][keybind="Use"][/bold][/color] performs standard interactions. They depend on the item held and what you click on.
Some items have [bold]alternative interactions[/bold], such as locking lockers and ejecting sub-items from other items. To perform [color=cyan]alternative interactions[/color], use [color=yellow][bold][keybind="AltActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color].
Many items have use-in-hand interactions, such as opening a bottle, reloading a gun or switching to holding an axe with both hands. To activate or use a held item, press the [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ActivateItemInHand"][/bold][/color] hotkey or click [color=yellow][bold][keybind="Use"][/bold][/color] on it. The alternative counterpart is [color=yellow][bold][keybind="AltActivateItemInHand"][/bold][/color] or [color=yellow][bold][keybind="AltActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color].
You can interact with objects even when your hands are full. Perform [color=cyan]activation interactions[/color] by pressing [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color]. This allows you to interact with the world without picking items up and without using the items you're holding. (Note: The alternative counterpart is still [color=yellow][bold][keybind="AltActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color].)
You can also perform regular interactions with items inside your inventories.
As you see, the game features [bold]three[/bold] main types of context-sensitive interactions accessible through different methods. You can always click [color=yellow][bold][keybind="UIRightClick"/][/bold][/color] on an interactive entity to open the [color=cyan]context menu[/color]. This menu displays [bold][italic]standard[/italic][/bold], [bold]activation[/bold], [italic]alternative[/italic] (usually formatted like that), and any other possible interactions all in one list.
If you're ever unsure about any entity, whether it's an object or a mob, you can [color=cyan]examine[/color] it by pressing [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ExamineEntity"][/bold][/color]. This opens a window displaying its name, a brief description, relevant details, and sometimes a link to the guidebook seen as an icon with a question mark.
## Drag and drop "Using" mobs (mobile entities such as players) requires a unique type of interaction:
- Drag a mob onto a chair, a bed or objects like the medical scanner to place them onto it.
- Drag yourself onto a table to climb it (also doable with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="AltActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color]).
- Drag another player onto yourself to open the [bold]strip menu[/bold], allowing you to take their equipment.
## Camera The camera can [color=cyan]zoom[/color] in and out with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ZoomIn"][/bold][/color] and [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ZoomOut"][/bold][/color] and can be reset with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ResetZoom"][/bold][/color]. Similarly, you can [color=cyan]rotate[/color] it left and right with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="CameraRotateLeft"][/bold][/color] and [color=yellow][bold][keybind="CameraRotateRight"][/bold][/color] and reset it with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="CameraReset"][/bold][/color].
For more details about controls, please refer to the [color=cyan]Wiki[/color].
